qandaentry.xreflabel: How to create a document with answers to sumit

question.para: How to create a document with answers to be submitted?

answer.para: Creating a HTML document with one or several exercises can be easily done with the rules presented in the previous sections (see , for example). But in some cases, certain activities require more than one document and more importantly, the possibility of interfacing the documents with other platforms.
ADA offers the possibility of preparing a set of files around the concept of exercise. The scenario that is assumed is the following:

listitem.para: The exercise needs one or more documents given to the students describing the steps to obtain the required answers. This document will be referred to as the hand out (see for more details).

A second document, similar to the previous one but including these solutions. It could be used for publication at a later stage, for the teaching staff to have during class, etc. This document will be referred to as the solutions (see for more details).

A third document explicitly oriented only to the teaching staff including descriptions of the tasks to perform, comments, evaluation criteria, etc. This document is concieved such that it never is shown to the students and thus will be reffered as the professor guide (see for more details).

An additional HTML page to be able to submit the answers. This is simply an HTML form but the elements to submit are derived from the problems included in the hand out. The assumption is that when designing a problem, these parts can be written next to each other and through profiling, they are separated into different documents. This document will be referred to as the submission page (see for more details).

Additional possibilities to include in these documents such as a typical set of fields in the submission page, a countdown in the hand-out and submission documents showing the remaining time until deadline, etc.

answer.para: In the previously described scenario, the variables to be used in the Properties.txt are the following:

If used, this rule creates the documents previously described, that is: hand-out, solutions, professor guide and submission page. It is for this reason that two stylesheet files are specified. The variable exercisesubmit.style.file is used to produce the hand out, solutions and professor guide document. The variable exercisesubmit.submit.style.file is used to obtain the submission page. Multilingual versions of all these documents can be produced using the exercisesubmit.multilingual.files.
